metadata.title: CVE-2024-27282 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Ruby 3.x through 3.3.0. If attacker-supplieddata is provided to the Ruby regex compiler, it is possible to extractarbitrary heap data relative to the start of the text, including pointersand sensitive strings. The fixed versions are 3.0.7, 3.1.5, 3.2.4, and3.3.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27282` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.13
ruby2.7 - 2.7.0-5ubuntu1.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.7 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-5ubuntu1.13').
jruby package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
